intro: Cylista balfourii, commonly known as the Balfour's cylista, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Cylista balfourii is considered a vulnerable species.
